definition: to poke through a hornets' nest/to attack a difficult task resolutely
to stab/to poke/to prod/to nudge/to disclose
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
old variant of 蜂[feng1]
variant of 蜂[feng1]
bee/wasp
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods

sentences.english: They warned him not to srir up a nest of hornets.
sentences.chinese: 他们警告他不要捅马蜂窝。

sentences.english: Why are you trying to stir up a hornet's nest?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么要去捅马蜂窝呢？

sentences.english: If you like defusing explosives, you'll love creating surveys.
sentences.chinese: 如果喜欢捅马蜂窝，你就会喜爱调查表。

sentences.english: We're just about to kick a beehive.

definition: hornet
to invite trouble
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
variant of 馬蜂|马蜂[ma3 feng1]
to sting
jellyfish
to climb a wall/(fig.) to be unfaithful
to harm others without benefiting oneself (idiom)
to be lacking in moral sense/to lack common basic respect for others/lacking in virtue/mischievous/wicked/cruel/mean
to jump into a well (to drown oneself, esp. of ladies in fiction)
to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
to chop wood/to chop down trees
to play with fire
lit. an egg colliding with a rock (idiom)/fig. to attack sb stronger than oneself/to overrate one's abilities
to pick flowers/to enter houses at night in order to rape women
to court disaster/also pr. [zuo1 si3]
to fight/to scuffle/to come to blows/CL:場|场[chang2]
